title: Click-through toasts please!
comment: Toasts are not click-through, despite your reply that they are. I have tried on 3 different phones, the latest being my Samsung Galaxy SIII, and previously, Samsung Galaxy Centura, and Samsung Galaxy Proclaim, all with stock roms. If you can make it possible to click buttons under the toasts I would love it even more. Thank you.

Thanks! But please submit your requests via the in-app "Report bug/Feedback" option or send an e-mail to pragma78@gmail.com.  That being said -- toasts are click-through by design (if this is not the case for you, I'd like to know more about what ROM/apps you're using -- e-mail me); and sure, I can add a slider to set the transparency of the toast.

title: Ben
comment: Very useful app, but it does lack the ability to permanently log all data into a file, e.g. if phone is turned off and then on again, data is lost, also needs to be able to automatically start-up when phone turned on and automatically start logging.  would be a good idea to also have ascii text table showing what app did what on what date and time.   Needs to be able to show TOTAL number of b/Kb/MB/ used by all apps  using data as well, besides this the ap is very good. Keep the hard work up!!!

All data is logged to a file. When the app is restarted (e.g., phone is turned off and then on) it loads a user-selected time-period of log history. The default is the past few hours; so if your phone is off for longer than that it won't load anything because nothing was logged during that period. You can increase the default to 24 hours or more.

title: Not working.
comment: Galaxy Tab Pro 8.4 KK 4.4.2 Gives ARM V7 access denied errors.

This is likely due to restrictive SELinux policies on Samsung devices.  Open a root shell and execute 'setenforce 0' and restart the app.  If it continues to not work, it may be due to KNOX.  Try executing 'pm disable com.sec.knox.seandroid'.  If it still does not work, use the in-app Report Bug/Feedback option to send me further details.

title: Root access required
comment: :-)~  Sorry to disappoint you. If I could remove the rating I would, but I can't, so I won't. If you want it removed then have them remove it.  There has to be a respectable developer out there that has created a firewall/logger app not requiring a rooted phone. Once again, apologies for your disappointment.   Ignorance is bliss.  Now where did I put my blue pill?

The functionality provided by this app requires certain features that only root can access. There are many resources available online that provide a step-by-step guide of how and why to root your device.  Some even provide a one-click tool that does it for you. I'm sorry you do not yet have root, and I'm disappointed by this 1 star rating.  :-(

I agree about the icon; unfortunately I am a simple programmer, not an artist.  If anyone is willing to donate an icon, I'd be glad to look at it.  Making the text transparent would make it much more difficult to read.  Android Toast messages are limited to SHORT and LONG, 2 and 3.5 seconds.  I'm using a little bit of a hack to allow 7 seconds.

title: Great app, fast support from dev
comment: Unfortunately it's a battery eater.

Its battery consumption should be minimal. Network transmissions are expensive and will drain the battery quickly, as anybody using Pandora/Spotify/Netflix/YouTube will notice. And now that you mention it, I have an idea to add a sleep mode with which you can tell Network Log to pause logging for X minutes/hours while you use one of those apps.

title: Wow
comment: Awesome!!!! I was looking for something like this for hours, and was thinking of writing something small myself - but this is much better!! the fact that the logging is so detailed is helping identify not only heavy usage apps, but also apps that keep your phone awake for naught.  It would be great to have CPU, wakelock usage etc. I know there are other apps that do that well - but it will be great to have everything in the same place, so I can actually compare CPU peaks, network peaks etc. over time.  This is a 5 star for sure.

title: Keep developing it!
comment: Look forward to seeing this down the pipe.

title: Awesome, but needs more flexibility in output
comment: Very useful and detailed, and easy to use. Though I consider it a 5 star app (honestly, more like 4.5 stars), there are some things I would like to see added.  Most importantly I think, is better unit display with the apps list. I don't want to see that an app has used "16244572 bytes", it should automatically update to display in KB, MB, or GB, depending on how large the number is. At least put commas in the number so I can more quickly judge the order of magnitude.  Similarly, the graphs are very nice, but the axis labels should be rounded to more convenient numbers. I appreciate the graphs adjusting them so the data fills the whole thing, but instead of making the labels at increments of 126.3 KB, which is unintuitive to read, it should display at 100 KB, or 150 KB, or something like that. Same thing for the times at the bottom; with the size of the graph and the amount of data on it, giving me readouts to milliseconds is completely meaningless. Instead, make the labels appear at whole-number hours, which again would be much more intuitive.  Finally, I would love to be able to export the data, either to a spreadsheet, or even a pdf of the graph for to see on larger screen.
You wish has been granted.  Version 2.20.0 introduces an export feature!
Excellent app!
